messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] sites/resources for architectural modeling/design
messages.msgSnippet: Lyla, My kids use the Roller Coaster Tycoon software by Atari for this.  If you look online at the Atari site, under the forums, you ll see many people who
messages.messageBody:
Lyla,

My kids use the "Roller Coaster Tycoon" software by Atari for this. If you
look online at the Atari site, under the forums, you'll see many people who
make custom scenery for the game which adds to the building possibilities.
My boys have made very complex parks over the years!
http://www.atari.com/rollercoastertycoon/

Michelle

_____

From: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com [mailto:AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com]
On Behalf Of Lyla Wolfenstein
Sent: Sunday, March 29, 2009 12:36 PM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] sites/resources for architectural modeling/design



my son saw a contest by blizzard entertainment to design a warcraft theme
park. he became quite excited, but then realized the deadline is tomorrow.
however, he has decided to do it just for fun, not for the contest. any
great sites or resources or experiences for doing this? he wants to do it in
many iterations - drawing, three dimensional, etc.

thanks!

Lyla
